repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Southern Regional
            Agricultural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Yemen Southern Regional Agricultural
            Development Project. The main objectives of the project
            were: (a) to increase agricultural productivity and incomes
            of farmers on 120,000 hectares, including those of the low
            rainfall areas of the region by means of improved
            agricultural services; improved utilization of land and
            water resources; and special assistance to women farmers;
            and (b) to improve the health and nutrition standards of the
            rural families through improved extension services to rural
            women. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned from the project were as follows: (a) the
            timely availability of adequate recurrent local operational
            budget is vital for the long-term sustainability of the
            project; (b) effective management of complex projects
            requires an efficient regional coordination mechanism; (c)
            there is a need to set up and implement a pragmatic
            mechanism to forge effective and close links between
            extension and research activities under the concerned
            projects; (d) the development and adoption of M and E
            systems should build on existing practices and take into
            account the national capacity and training needs to enable
            local operation and management of the systems; and (e) the
            benefits of close and coordinated working relationship with
            other cofinanciers of the project.

18155310.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen Arab Republic - Southern Regional
            Agricultural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Southern Regional
            Agricultural Development Project are to increase
            agricultural productivity and incomes of farmers of the
            Southern Region by providing improved agricultural services
            including operation and maintenance of agricultural
            infrastructure, improved utilization of land and water
            resources, special assistance to women farmers; and improved
            services for rural women to raise the health and nutrition
            standards of the rural families. The project consists of
            construction of facilities, and the provision of vehicles
            and equipment, the establishment and strengthening of
            regional support services in agricultural extension, rural
            development for women and veterinary services.  The project
            further entails operation and maintenance; development of a
            tree nursery; provision  of fertilizer; and construction of
            subbranches for the Cooperative and Agricultural Credit Bank
            (CACB).  In addition, the project aims to establish
            demonstration farms to train farmers in irrigation and
            agricultural practices; rehabilitate irrigation schemes (350
            ha); undertake a water resources study on the Wadi Bana
            area; and provide technical assistance and training.
